contentrichtext.text: {{NZ parlbox header}} {{NZ parlbox|term=47th|start=2004|end=2005|list=10|electorate=List|party=ACT New Zealand}} {{NZ parlbox footer}}'''Kenneth Xiaoxuan Wang''' (Chinese 王小选)(born 1955) was a [[New Zealand]] politician and businessman, and a member of the [[ACT New Zealand]] party. He entered [[Parliament of New Zealand|Parliament]] to replace [[Donna Awatere Huata]], who was expelled from [[Parliament of New Zealand|Parliament]] on 19 November 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=3612917|title=New MP joins Act in Parliament|date=23 November 2004|work=The New Zealand Herald|accessdate=16 February 2010}}</ref> Wang was sworn in on 30 November 2004. Wang was born in [[China]], and has three siblings. He arrived in New Zealand in 1984 and is married with two children. Wang worked in the [[marketing]] and [[advertising]] sector in [[Auckland]]. He was New Zealand's second Chinese MP (with the first being [[Pansy Wong]]). At the [[New Zealand general election, 2005|2005 elections]] Wang contested the seat of Mt Roskill, and was seventh on [[Act New Zealand|ACT]]'s party list. However, he was not returned to [[Parliament of New Zealand|Parliament]]. In the [[New Zealand general election, 2008|2008 general election]] he stood unsuccessfully in the Electorate of [[Botany (New Zealand electorate)|Botany]] for the [[ACT New Zealand]] Party. National candidate [[Pansy Wong]] filed a complaint to the electoral commission about Wang's billboards which exhorted "Vote for Wang, get Wang and Wong" (because Pansy Wong's high rank on the National Party List assured her of a seat in parliament).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.times.co.nz/cms/news/2008/10/wang_wong_gone_wrong.php|title=Wang Wong gone wrong |date=2 October 2008|work=Howick and Pakuranga Times|accessdate=16 February 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz-election-2008/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501799&objectid=10541171|title=Wang accuses opponent of dirty tactics|last=Tan |first=Lincoln |date=5 November 2008|work=The New Zealand Herald|accessdate=16 February 2010}}</ref> == References == {{reflist}} {{ACT New Zealand}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wang, Kenneth | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = New Zealand politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1955 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wang, Kenneth}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:ACT New Zealand MPs]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New Zealand people of Chinese descent]] {{NewZealand-politician-stub}}
